meanings.definition: The quality or state of being rhythmic.
meanings.sent1: Her dance had a beautiful rhythmicity to it.
meanings.sent2: The music's rhythmicity made it easy to tap your foot along.
meanings.sent3: The rhythmicity of the clock ticking almost sounded like a tiny drummer.
meanings.sent4: The rhythmicity of the waves crashing against the shore was like nature's own heartbeat.
meanings.sent5: The rhythmicity of the drumbeats echoed through the forest.

meanings.definition: The regular recurrence of a pattern of sounds or movements.
meanings.sent1: The rhythmicity of the train passing by was comforting.
meanings.sent2: The rhythmicity of the metronome helped the musician stay in time.
meanings.sent3: The rhythmicity of the raindrops on the roof sounded like a soothing melody.
meanings.sent4: The rhythmicity of the dancers' steps created a mesmerizing performance.
meanings.sent5: The rhythmicity of the pendulum swinging back and forth was hypnotic.
